materials.raw_text: Cs: 40 g, In: 30 g, Li: 20 g, P: 10 g, Tm: 5 g.

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online specialty store. In: Order from a metal or chemical vendor. Li: Obtain from battery materials suppliers. P: Acquire from a chemical supply company. Tm: Source from rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online specialty store. In: Order from a metal or chemical vendor. Li: Obtain from battery materials suppliers. P: Acquire from a chemical supply company. Tm: Source from rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Gather all materials and weigh them precisely. 2. In a clean, dry container, mix 40 g of Cs with 30 g of In. 3. Slowly add 20 g of Li while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 4. Gradually incorporate 10 g of P and mix thoroughly. 5. Finally, add 5 g of Tm and mix until the compound is homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Gather all materials and weigh them precisely. 2. In a clean, dry container, mix 40 g of Cs with 30 g of In. 3. Slowly add 20 g of Li while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 4. Gradually incorporate 10 g of P and mix thoroughly. 5. Finally, add 5 g of Tm and mix until the compound is homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 800 °C and maintain for 2 hours to achieve proper fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to a temperature of 800 °C and maintain for 2 hours to achieve proper fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approx. 4-6 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approx. 4-6 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or rough edges. 3. If needed, sand down rough surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant for surface protection.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any irregularities or rough edges. 3. If needed, sand down rough surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant for surface protection.
